verbs.description: [ARGM-TMP: Just] [ARGM-TMP: when] it [V: seemed] [ARG1: like the Group of Seven summit had come to a surprisingly uneventful end] , President Donald Trump stepped in with two tweets that blew up the whole thing .
Just when it seemed like the Group of Seven summit [V: had] come to a surprisingly uneventful end , President Donald Trump stepped in with two tweets that blew up the whole thing .
Just when it seemed like [ARG1: the Group of Seven summit] had [V: come] [ARG2: to a surprisingly uneventful end] , President Donald Trump stepped in with two tweets that blew up the whole thing .

[ARGM-TMP: Just when it seemed like the Group of Seven summit had come to a surprisingly uneventful end] , [ARG1: President Donald Trump] [V: stepped] in [ARGM-MNR: with two tweets that blew up the whole thing] .

Just when it seemed like the Group of Seven summit had come to a surprisingly uneventful end , President Donald Trump stepped in with [ARG0: two tweets] [R-ARG0: that] [V: blew] up [ARG1: the whole thing] .
